sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Giorgia Maloney has been sworn in as Italy's first female Prime Minister and the country's first far-right leader to head the nation's government since the Second World War.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Her coalition allies include the right-wing League of Matteo Salvini and the conservative Forza Italia party, headed by former Premier Silvio Berlusconi.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Forty-five-year-old Maloney took the oath of office before the Italian President Sergio Mattarella at the Presidential Palace on Saturday morning. The new leader had announced her cabinet on Friday ahead of the swearing-in ceremony.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Her deputy and Minister for Foreign Affairs is Antonio Tahini, a former journalist and soldier who served as President of the European Parliament between 2017 and 2019.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Although Maloney's Brothers of Italy party won the election taking 26% of the vote, she still needed the support of Matteo Salvini's anti-migrant League party and former Premier Silvio Berlusconi's Forza Italia to form a coalition.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Their parties polled 8% of the vote each in the election, but saw a record low turnout. And although they'll all be working together, there have already been tensions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Berlusconi and Salvini are longtime admirers of Russian President Vladimir Putin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Maloney staunchly backs Ukraine in its defense against the Russian invasion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Fresh Russian airstrikes targeted energy infrastructure in western Ukraine on Saturday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: President Vladimir Zelensky has accused Moscow of firing 36 rocket missiles, which he claims has left over one million homes without power.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: It comes as Russia looks to intensify its assault on Ukraine's power stations, water supply systems and other key infrastructure.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Russia's defense ministry has reported that its forces had repelled Ukrainian offensives in the eastern regions of Luhansk and Donetsk and the southern region of Kherson.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: A Kremlin spokesperson reported that over 130 Ukrainian soldiers had died, while two tanks and nine armoured vehicles were destroyed in the fighting.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Kiev says 2,000 Russian draftees have entered the Kherson region to bolster units on the front line.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Russia-installed authorities in Kherson have urged civilians to leave immediately ahead of a potential Ukrainian advance.

sentences.sentence: The region was illegally annexed by Moscow in September.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Experts say Kyiv is looking to drive Russian troops out of Kherson in what could be one of the war's most crucial battles yet.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: As darkness falls on the Ukrainian city of Mykolaiv, the ominous sound of Iranian drones launched by Russian forces can be heard throughout the night.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: It's often only at dawn that the local bomb squad is able to uncover the damage caused by these unmanned devices.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: These drones have been described as rudimentary, with wooden propellers, but they are also extremely dangerous.

sentences.sentence: It's a weapon that ignites the air.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: China's 20th Communist Party Congress wrapped up on Saturday,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: with President Xi Jinping set to gain an unprecedented third five-year term.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The Congress, which takes place every five years, includes roughly 2,300 party delegates who meet to reshuffle the country's leadership and set its national agenda for the next five years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: During its finale, China's president said, country's leadership and set its national agenda for the next five years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: During its finale, China's president said, I now announce the victorious closing of the 20th Congress of the Communist Party of China.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The ending of the highly choreographed Congress was also marked by the country's former leader, Hu Jintao, being led out of the closing ceremony.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The 79-year-old was sitting next to Xi when he was led away by two men.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: No official explanation was given. The Congress also marked the election of a new Central Committee, a group of around 200 members that leads China's ruling party.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The breakdown of this group has not been revealed, but Xi is widely expected to be reappointed as its general secretary.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Former UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson cut short his Caribbean holiday to return to the UK on Saturday, ahead of a potential bid to replace his replacement Liz Truss as leader. Johnson was forced to leave Downing Street just three months ago after being ousted by his own government amid a series of scandals and controversies. Current leader of the House of Commons Penny Mordaunt was the first candidate to publicly declare that she is running for office. On Friday she took to social media promising she could deliver a fresh start for the Conservative Party.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Boris Johnson's former finance minister Rishi Sunak is the favourite to be named the next UK Prime Minister.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Media reports suggest Sunak has already received enough nominations from Tory MPs to pass the threshold required to stand for leader.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Candidates must secure the support of at least 100 Conservative MPs by next Monday afternoon.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: If two or more contenders emerge, party members get to cast their ballot online next Friday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Inside the libraries of a remote monastery on Mount Athos in Greece, historians are looking into what could be the oldest surviving documents from the Ottoman Empire.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The thousands of documents give a glimpse into the life on the peninsula as far back as 1374, a feat that some researchers claim would be impossible without this latest find.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The oldest documents in Istanbul's archives, which became the center of the empire, were written around a century later.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: There are approximately 1,300 original Byzantine documents. More don't exist anywhere else.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Here we have the most ancient Ottoman documents before the fall of Constantinople, which are kept in Mount Athos's monasteries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Can you read it here? What does it say? which are kept in Mount Athos's monasteries. Many of the 25,000 documents are legal texts, including deeds of ownership and court decisions, showing what it was like when the Ottoman Empire first took control of the region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: empire first took control of the region. The sultans kept Mount Athos as the last remnant of Byzantium, semi-independent and didn't touch it. They didn't even keep troops there.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The monk's small democracy was able to gain the respect of all conquering powers in the region and that's because Mount Athos was seen as a cradle of peace and culture.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The documents also revealed that for the first two centuries of Ottoman rule, the region's leaders did not try to impose Islamic law on its inhabitants.
